Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on imperial command
The nature and maturity of the three fetters, etc., the view of annihilation, having roots, being bound,
Being fully accomplished, conditions, I wish to fully explain this chapter.
There are:
Three fetters.
They are:
The fetter of the view of self-existence, the fetter of grasping rules and rituals, and the fetter of doubt.
Three unwholesome roots.
They are:
The unwholesome root of greed, the unwholesome root of hatred, and the unwholesome root of delusion.
Three taints.
They are:
The taint of desire, the taint of existence, and the taint of ignorance.ğŸ”½Four floods.
They are:
The flood of desire, the flood of existence, the flood of views, and the flood of ignorance.
Four yokes.
They are:
The yoke of desire, the yoke of existence, the yoke of views, and the yoke of ignorance.
Four clingings.
They are:
Desire-attachment, false-view attachment, precept and vow attachment, and self-assertion attachment.
Four bodily fetters.
â€”â€” Namely:
Bodily fetter of sensual desire, bodily fetter of ill-will, bodily fetter of adherence to rules and rituals, and bodily fetter of assertion of a real self.
Five hindrances.
â€”â€” Namely:
Hindrance of sensual desire, hindrance of ill-will, hindrance of sloth and torpor, hindrance of restlessness and remorse, and hindrance of doubt.
Five lower fetters.
â€”â€” Namely:
Lower fetter of sensual desire, lower fetter of ill-will, lower fetter of clinging to (wrong) views, lower fetter of adherence to rules and rituals, and lower fetter of doubt.
Five higher fetters.
â€”â€” Namely:
Higher fetter of desire for fine-material existence, higher fetter of desire for immaterial existence, higher fetter of conceit, higher fetter of restlessness, and higher fetter of ignorance.
Five views.
â€”â€” Namely:
The view of the existence of a self, the view of grasping extremes, wrong views, the view of holding a view as paramount, and the view of holding morality and asceticism as paramount.
Six bases of craving.
â€”â€” Namely:
The craving that arises from eye contact, and the craving that arises from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact.
Seven latent afflictions.
â€”â€” Namely:

translated: The latent affliction of desire for sensual pleasure, the latent affliction of ill-will, the latent affliction of desire for existence, the latent affliction of pride, the latent affliction of ignorance, the latent affliction of views, and the latent affliction of doubt.
Nine fetters.
â€”â€” Namely:

The fetter of desire, the fetter of ill-will, the fetter of pride, the fetter of ignorance, the fetter of views, the fetter of grasping, the fetter of doubt, the fetter of envy, and the fetter of stinginess.
Ninety-eight latent afflictions.
Namely:
Thirty-six latent afflictions bound to the desire realm, and thirty-one latent afflictions bound to each of the form and formless realms.
Among the three fetters up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions, how many are unwholesome?
How many are indeterminate?
Answer:ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Among the three fetters:
One is indeterminate, two should be distinguished.
That is to say:
The fetters of clinging to precepts and practices and doubt:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, in the form and formless realms they are indeterminate.
The three unwholesome roots:
Only unwholesome.
Among the three taints:
One is indeterminate, two should be distinguished.
That is to say:
The taint of desire:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
Those associated with shamelessness and disregard are unwholesome, the rest are indeterminate.
The taint of ignorance:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
Those associated with shamelessness and disregard are unwholesome, the rest are indeterminate.
Among the four floods:
One is indeterminate, three should be distinguished.
That is to say:
The flood of desire:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
Those associated with shamelessness and disregard are unwholesome, the rest are indeterminate.
The flood of views:
They may be unwholesome or indeterminate.
The three views in the desire realm are unwholesome;
the two views in the desire realm and the five views in the form and formless realms are indeterminate.
The flood of ignorance:
It may be unwholesome or indeterminate.
That associated with shamelessness and lack of conscience is unwholesome, the rest is indeterminate.
As with the four floods,
the four bonds are also like this.
Among the four graspings:
One is indeterminate, three should be distinguished.
Namely:
The grasping of desire:
It may be unwholesome or indeterminate.
That associated with shamelessness and lack of conscience is unwholesome, the rest is indeterminate.
The grasping of views:
It may be unwholesome or indeterminate.
The two views in the desire realm are unwholesome;
the two views in the desire realm and the four views in the form and formless realms are indeterminate.
The grasping of precepts and vows:ğŸ”½It may be unwholesome or indeterminate.
That in the desire realm is unwholesome, that in the form and formless realms is indeterminate.
Among the four bodily ties:
Two are unwholesome, and two should be distinguished.
Namely:
The bodily ties of clinging to precepts and observances and the grasping of rules and rituals:
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, and in the form and formless realms they are indeterminate.
The five hindrances:
They are only unwholesome.
Among the five bonds:
Three are unwholesome, and two should be distinguished.
Namely:
The bonds of craving and conceit:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, and in the form and formless realms they are indeterminate.
Among the five lower fetters:
Two are unwholesome.
One is indeterminate.
Two should be distinguished.
Namely:
The bonds of clinging to precepts and observances and doubt:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, and in the form and formless realms they are indeterminate.
The five higher fetters:
They are only indeterminate.
Among the five views:
Two are indeterminate, and three should be distinguished.
Namely:
Wrong view, attachment to views, and attachment to precepts and vows:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, in the form and formless realms they are indeterminate.
Among the six bases of craving:
Two are unwholesome, four should be distinguished.
Namely:
The bases of craving born from eye, ear, and body contact:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, in the Brahma world they are indeterminate.
The bases of craving born from mind contact:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, in the form and formless realms they are indeterminate.
Among the seven latent afflictions:
Two are unwholesome, one is indeterminate, four should be distinguished.
Namely:
The latent afflictions of pride and doubt:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
In the desire realm they are unwholesome, in the form and formless realms they are indeterminate.
The latent affliction of ignorance:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
Those associated with shamelessness and disregard are unwholesome, the rest are neutral.
The latent tendencies of views:
Either unwholesome or neutral.
Three views in the desire realm are unwholesome.
Two views in the desire realm and five views in the form and formless realms are neutral.
Among the nine fetters:
Three are unwholesome.
Six should be distinguished.
Namely:
The fetters of craving, conceit, clinging, and doubt:
Either unwholesome or neutral.
Those in the desire realm are unwholesome, those in the form and formless realms are neutral.
The fetter of ignorance:
Either unwholesome or neutral.
Those associated with shamelessness and disregard are unwholesome, the rest are neutral.
The fetter of views:
Either unwholesome or neutral.
One view in the desire realm is unwholesome;
Two views in the desire realm and three views in the form and formless realms are neutral.
Among the ninety-eight latent tendencies:
Thirty-three are unwholesome, sixty-four are indeterminate, and one should be distinguished.
Namely:
The latent tendency of ignorance to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm:
Either unwholesome or indeterminate.
That associated with shamelessness and lack of conscience is unwholesome, the rest are indeterminate.
Among the three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent tendencies, how many have karmic retribution?
How many have no karmic retribution?
Answer:
The unwholesome have karmic retribution, the indeterminate have no karmic retribution.
Among the three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent tendencies, how many are eliminated by seeing?
How many are eliminated by cultivation?
Answer:
Among the three fetters - the fetter of personality view has two phrases:
Either eliminated by seeing or eliminated by seeing and cultivation.

If the personality view is bound to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, eliminated by the perseverance for the realization of the knowledge of suffering of the stage of the direct-seeing of the faith-follower and the doctrine-follower, it is eliminated by seeing.
The remaining [afflictions] - if one is an ordinary person, they are eliminated by the path of cultivation;
if one is a disciple of the World-Honored One, they are eliminated by the path of seeing.
Just as with the fetter of the view of self:ğŸ”½Among the five lower fetters, the fetter of the view of self;
Among the five views, the views of self and extreme views;
are also like this.
The fetters of clinging to precepts and vows and doubt, preceded by views, have two phrases:
Either eliminated by the path of seeing or eliminated by the path of cultivation.

If clinging to precepts and vows and doubt are bound to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, eliminated by the receptivity at the end of the stream of defilements of the path of seeing for those who progress by faith and those who progress by the teaching, they are eliminated by the path of seeing.
The remaining [afflictions] - if one is an ordinary person, they are eliminated by the path of cultivation;
if one is a disciple of the World-Honored One, they are eliminated by the path of seeing.
Just as with the fetters of clinging to precepts and vows and doubt:ğŸ”½Among the four floods and yokes, the flood and yoke of views;
Among the four graspings, the grasping of views and the grasping of precepts and vows;
Among the four fetters, the fetters of adherence to rules and rituals and of adherence to mere personal rules and rituals;
Among the five lower fetters, the fetters of adherence to rules and rituals and of doubt;
Among the five views, the views of wrong views, of holding a view as paramount, and of adherence to mere personal rules and rituals;
Among the seven latent afflictions, the latent afflictions of views and doubt;
Among the nine fetters, the fetters of adherence to views and doubt;
â€”â€”are also like this.
The unwholesome root of greed is preceded by cultivation.
There are two sentences:
Either eliminated by cultivation, or eliminated by both seeing and cultivation.
If the unwholesome root of greed is eliminated by the knowledge of those in training and those on the path of seeing, it is eliminated by cultivation.
The rest, if eliminated by ordinary beings, are eliminated by cultivation;
If eliminated by the disciples of the World-Honored One, they are eliminated by seeing.
Just as with the unwholesome root of greed:
The unwholesome roots of hatred and delusion;
Among the three taints, the taint of sensual desire;ğŸ”½Among the four floods and yokes, the flood and yoke of sensual desire;
Among the four graspings, the grasping of sensual desire;
Among the four fetters, the fetters of sensual desire and ill will;
Among the five hindrances, except for restlessness and doubt, the rest;ğŸ”½Among the five lower fetters, the fetter of ill will;
Among the five lower fetters, the fetters of sensual desire and ill will;
Among the seven latent afflictions, the latent afflictions of desire and ill will;
Among the nine fetters, the fetter of ill will;
â€”â€”are also like this.
The contaminants of existence and ignorance are preceded by views.
There are three sentences:
Either eliminated by seeing, or eliminated by cultivation, or eliminated by both seeing and cultivation.

If the contaminants of existence and ignorance are bound to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and are eliminated by the receptivities at the edge of the direct realizations of those who follow faith and those who follow the dharma, they are eliminated by seeing.
If the contaminants of existence and ignorance are eliminated by the knowledges of those in training and those who have attained the traces of the path of seeing, they are eliminated by cultivation.
The rest, if eliminated by worldlings, are eliminated by cultivation;
If eliminated by the disciples of the World-Honored One, they are eliminated by seeing.
Like the contaminated and ignorance contaminants:
Among the four floods and yokes, the existence and ignorance floods and yokes;
Among the four graspings, the grasping of doctrines;
Among the five bonds, the bonds of craving and pride;
Among the six bases of contact and feeling, the base of contact and feeling born of mental contact;
Among the seven latent afflictions, the latent afflictions of craving for existence, pride, and ignorance;
Among the nine bonds, the bonds of craving, pride, and ignorance;
â€”are also like this.
The hindrances of remorse are eliminated by cultivation.
Like the hindrance of remorse:
Among the five bonds, the bonds of jealousy and stinginess;
The five higher bonds;
Among the six bases of contact and feeling, the first five bases of contact and feeling;
Among the nine bonds, the bonds of jealousy and stinginess;
â€”are also like this.
The hindrance of doubt:
If one is an ordinary person, it is eliminated by cultivation;
If one is a disciple of the World-Honored One, it is eliminated by insight.
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions:
Twenty-eight are eliminated by insight, ten are eliminated by cultivation.
The rest - if ordinary beings, they are eliminated by the elimination of the afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation;
if the disciples of the World-Honored One, they are eliminated by the elimination of the afflictions to be eliminated by insight.
How many of the three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions are eliminated by insight into suffering?
... up to how many are eliminated by cultivation?
The answer:
Among the three fetters:
The fetter of the view of the body as real is eliminated by insight into suffering.
Just as the fetter of the view of the body as real:ğŸ”½Among the five lower fetters, the fetter of the view of the body as real;
Among the five views, the fetter of the view of the body as real and the extreme view;
- are also like this.
The fetter of clinging to precepts and vows is of two kinds:
Either eliminated by insight into suffering, or eliminated by insight into the path.
Just as the fetter of clinging to precepts and vows:ğŸ”½Among the four kinds of grasping, the grasping of precepts and vows;
Among the four kinds of bodily bondage, the bodily bondage of clinging to precepts and vows;
Among the five lower fetters, the fetter of clinging to precepts and vows;
Among the five views, the view of clinging to precepts and vows;
- are also like this.
The fetter of doubt is of four kinds:
Some are seen to be eliminated by [realizing] suffering, and so on, up to some are seen to be eliminated by [realizing] the path.
Just as with the fetter of doubt:ğŸ”½Among the four floods and yokes, the flood and yoke of views;
Among the four graspings, the grasping of views;
Among the four bodily ties, the bodily tie of grasping at views as supreme;
Among the five hindrances, the hindrance of doubt;
Among the five lower fetters, the fetter of doubt;
Among the five views, wrong view and the grasping of views as supreme;
Among the seven latent afflictions, the latent afflictions of views and doubt;
Among the nine fetters, the fetters of grasping views as supreme and doubt;
â€”are also like this.
There are five kinds of the three unwholesome roots:
Some are eliminated by [realizing] suffering,
and so on, up to some are eliminated by cultivation.
Just as with the three unwholesome roots:
The three floods;
Among the four floods and yokes, excluding views, the remaining floods and yokes;ğŸ”½Among the four graspings, the grasping of desire and the grasping of self-theories;
Among the four bodily ties, the bodily ties of craving and ill-will;
Among the five hindrances, except for remorse and doubt, the rest are [hindrances].ğŸ”½Among the five bonds, the bonds of greed, hatred, and conceit.
Among the five lower fetters, the fetters of sensual desire and ill will.
Among the six bases of contact, the base of contact that arises from mind-contact.
Among the seven latent afflictions, except for the views and doubts, the rest are [latent afflictions].
Among the nine bonds, the bonds of craving, hatred, conceit, and ignorance, are also [bonds].
The hindrance of remorse is to be eliminated by cultivation.
As with the hindrance of remorse:
Among the five bonds, the bonds of jealousy and stinginess.
The five higher fetters;
Among the six bases of contact, the first five bases of contact;
Among the nine bonds, the bonds of jealousy and stinginess, are also [bonds].
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions:

Twenty-eight are eliminated by seeing suffering, nineteen are eliminated by seeing the origin [of suffering], nineteen are eliminated by seeing cessation [of suffering], twenty-two are eliminated by seeing the path [to cessation of suffering], and ten are eliminated by cultivation.
The three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions.
How many are views?
How many are not views?
Answer:
Among the three fetters:
Two are views.
One is not a view.
The three unwholesome roots:
Are not views.
Among the three taints:
One is not a view.
Two should be distinguished.
Namely:
The taint of sensual desire:
May be a view, or may not be a view.
In the desire realm:
The five views are views.
The rest are not views.
The taint of existence:
May be a view, or may not be a view.
In the form and formless realms:
The five views are views.
The rest are not views.
Among the four floods and yokes:
One is a view.
Three are not views.
Among the four graspings and four bodily ties:
Both are two views and two are not views.
Among the five hindrances and five bonds:
Both are not views.
Among the five lower fetters:
Two are views.
Three are not views.
Among the five higher fetters:
Are not views.
The five views:
are views.
The six bases of craving:
are not views.
Among the seven latent afflictions:
one is a view, and six are not views.
Among the nine fetters:
two are views, and seven are not views.
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions:
thirty-six are views, and sixty-two are not views.
The three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions.
How many have investigation and analysis?ğŸ”½How many have no investigation but only analysis?
How many have no investigation and no analysis?
Answer:
The three fetters are of three kinds.
The three unwholesome roots and the desire realm contaminants have investigation and analysis.
The existence realm contaminants and the ignorance contaminant
except for the desire realm flood, yoke, and grasping.
The remaining floods, yokes, and graspings are of three kinds.
The desire realm flood, yoke, and grasping
have investigation and analysis.
The remaining three graspings and the three bodily ties
have investigation and analysis.
The remaining two bodily ties
are of three kinds. The five hindrancesğŸ”½are of three kinds.
and the three fetters.
With applied thought and sustained thought.
The remaining two fetters, and the three lower fetters, are of three kinds.
The remaining two lower fetters.
With applied thought and sustained thought.
Among the five higher fetters, attachment to the formless realm.
Without applied thought, with sustained thought only.
The remaining four, and the five views, are of three kinds.
The first five types of craving.
And the latent tendencies of sensual desire and ill-will.
With applied thought and sustained thought.
The sixth type of craving.
And the remaining five latent tendencies, are of three kinds.
Among the nine fetters, the fetters of anger, envy, and stinginess.
With applied thought and sustained thought.
The remaining six, are of three kinds.
Among the ninety-eight latent tendencies, the thirty-six in the desire realm.
With applied thought and sustained thought.
The thirty-one in the form realm are of three kinds.
The thirty-one in the formless realm.
Without applied thought, with sustained thought only.
The three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent tendencies.
How many are associated with the faculty of pleasure?
How many are associated with the faculties of suffering, joy, sorrow, and equanimity?
Answer:
Among the three bonds:
The bonds of the view of self and the grasping of precepts and rituals are associated with three faculties, excluding the faculties of suffering and sorrow.
The bond of doubt is associated with four faculties, excluding the faculty of suffering.
Among the three unwholesome roots:
The unwholesome root of greed is associated with three faculties, excluding the faculties of suffering and sorrow.
The unwholesome root of hatred is associated with three faculties, excluding the faculties of joy and pleasure.
The unwholesome root of delusion, as well as the defilement of sensual desire and the defilement of ignorance, are associated with five faculties.
The defilement of existence is associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of suffering and sorrow.
Among the four floods and yokes:
The floods and yokes of sensual desire and ignorance
are associated with five faculties.
The floods and yokes of existence are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of suffering and sorrow.
The floods and yokes of views are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of suffering.
Among the four graspings:
The desire to grasp is associated with the five faculties.
The view of grasping is associated with four faculties, excluding the faculty of suffering.
The grasping of precepts and vows and the grasping of self-existence are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of suffering and sorrow.
The fetter of anger is associated with three faculties, excluding the faculties of pleasure and joy.
The remaining three fetters and the hindrances of sensual desire are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of suffering and sorrow.
The hindrance of anger is associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and joy.
The hindrances of sloth and torpor and restlessness and worry are associated with five faculties.
The hindrance of sloth and torpor is associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and suffering.
The hindrances of remorse and doubt are associated with two faculties.
Namely:
The faculties of sorrow and equanimity.
Among the five bonds:
The bonds of craving and pride are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of suffering and sorrow.
The bond of anger is associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and joy.
The bond of envy is associated with two faculties.
Namely:
the faculties of sorrow and equanimity.
The fetter of stinginess is associated with two faculties.
Namely:
the faculties of joy and equanimity.
Among the five lower fetters:
The fetter of ill-will is associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and joy.
The fetter of doubt is associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.
The remaining three fetters are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pain and sorrow.
Among the five higher fetters:
The fetter of craving for the formless is associated with one faculty.
Namely:
the faculty of equanimity.
The remaining four fetters and four views are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pain and sorrow.
Wrong view is associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.
Among the six bases of contact:
The first five bases of contact are associated with two faculties.
Namely:
the faculties of pleasure and equanimity.
The sixth base of contact, as well as the latent tendencies of craving for sensual desires, craving for existence, and conceit, are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pain and sorrow.
The latent tendency of anger is associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and joy.
The latent tendencies of views and doubt are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.
The latent tendency of ignorance is associated with five faculties.
Among the nine fetters:
The fetters of craving, pride, and grasping are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pain and sorrow.
The fetter of anger is associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and joy.
The fetter of ignorance is associated with five faculties.
The fetters of views and doubt are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.
The fetter of jealousy is associated with two faculties.
Namely:
The faculties of sorrow and equanimity.
The fetter of stinginess is associated with two faculties.
Namely:
The faculties of joy and equanimity.
Among the ninety-eight latent tendencies:
The four views, pride, and the greed eliminated by the path of insight in the desire realm
are associated with two faculties.
Namely:
The faculties of joy and equanimity.
Doubt and the anger eliminated by the path of insight
are associated with two faculties.
Namely:
The faculties of sorrow and equanimity.
Wrong views and ignorance eliminated by the path of insight are associated with three faculties,
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and pain.
Craving eliminated by the path of cultivation is associated with three faculties,
Excluding the faculties of pain and sorrow.
Hatred is associated with three faculties,
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and joy.
Ignorance is associated with five faculties.
The thirty-one latent afflictions of the form realm are associated with three faculties,
Excluding the faculties of pain and sorrow.
The thirty-one latent afflictions of the formless realm
Are associated with one faculty of equanimity.
As for the three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions,
How many are bound to the desire realm?ğŸ”½How many are bound to the form realm?
How many are bound to the formless realm?
The answer is:
The three fetters are of three kinds.
The three unwholesome roots and the desire-based contaminants are bound to the desire realm.
The existence-based contaminants are of two kinds - either bound to the form realm or bound to the formless realm.
The ignorance-based contaminants are of three kinds.
the flood and yoke of sensual desire,
and the grasping of sensual desire.
They are bound to the desire realm.
The flood and yoke of existence,
and the grasping of the doctrine of self,
are of two kinds.ğŸ”½They are either bound to the form realm,
or bound to the formless realm.
The other floods and yokes,
and the other two graspings, are of three kinds.
Among the four bonds,
sensual desire, ill-will, and the five hindrances are bound to the desire realm.
The other two bonds are of three kinds.
Among the five bonds,
sensual desire and pride,
and the three bonds conducive to the lower realm, are of three kinds.
The other three bonds,
and the bonds of sensual desire and ill-will conducive to the lower realm,
are bound to the desire realm.
Among the five bonds conducive to the upper realm,ğŸ”½sensual desire in the form realm is bound to the form realm.
Sensual desire in the formless realm is bound to the formless realm.
The other three bonds are of two kinds.ğŸ”½They are either bound to the form realm,
or bound to the formless realm.
The five views and the sixth attachment are of three kinds.
The aggregate of craving produced by eye, ear, and body contact is of two kinds.
Either belonging to the desire realm,
or belonging to the form realm.
The aggregate of craving produced by nose and tongue contact,
belongs to the desire realm.
Among the seven latent afflictions,
desire-greed and ill-will,
belong to the desire realm.
Greed for existence is of two kinds.ğŸ”½Either belonging to the form realm,
or belonging to the formless realm.
The remaining latent afflictions are of three kinds.
Among the nine fetters,
the fetters of ill-will, envy, and stinginess,
belong to the desire realm.
The remaining fetters are of three kinds.
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions,
thirty-six belong to the desire realm,
thirty-one belong to the form realm,
and thirty-one belong to the formless realm.
Are the fetters that fall into the desire realm the fetters that exist in the desire realm?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There are fetters that fall into the desire realm, but those fetters do not exist in the desire realm.
This refers to:
When bound by defilements, one falls from the form realm and arises in the desire realm as an intermediate being.
And when the evil MÄra dwells in the Brahma realm.
Because of being bound by defilements, one reviles the TathÄgata.
There are bonds in the desire realm that are not bonds fallen into the desire realm.
Namely:ğŸ”½When bound by defilements, one falls from the desire realm and arises in the form realm as an intermediate being.
And when bonds of the form and formless realms are present while dwelling in the desire realm.
There are bonds fallen into the desire realm that are also bonds in the desire realm.
Namely:
When bound by defilements, one falls from the desire realm.
One arises in the desire realm as an intermediate being and birth existence.
And when dwelling in the desire realm.
When bonds of the desire realm are present.
There are bonds not fallen into the desire realm that are also not bonds in the desire realm.
Namely:

When bound by defilements, one falls from the form realm.ğŸ”½One arises in the form realm as an intermediate being and birth existence.ğŸ”½One falls from the form realm and is born in the formless realm.
One falls from the formless realm and is born in the formless realm.
When falling from the formless realm and being reborn in the form realm, and when abiding in the form realm, form and formless realm fetters manifest.
When abiding in the formless realm, formless realm fetters manifest.
Are all fetters that fall into the form realm those fetters that are in the form realm?
Answer:
One should make four alternatives.
There are fetters that fall into the form realm, but those fetters are not in the form realm.
This refers to:
Being bound by defilements, falling from the desire realm,
and giving rise to the intermediate existence of the form realm.
And when abiding in the desire realm, form realm fetters manifest.
There are fetters that are in the form realm, but those fetters do not fall into the form realm.
This refers to:
Being bound by defilements, falling from the form realm,
and giving rise to the intermediate existence of the desire realm.
And when the evil MÄra abides in the Brahma world, being bound by defilements,
he reviles the TathÄgata.
And when abiding in the form realm, formless realm fetters manifest.
There are fetters that fall into the form realm, and those fetters are also in the form realm.
This refers to:
Being bound by defilements, falling from the form realm,
Arising in the intermediate state of the form realm and the existence of birth.
And abiding in the form realm.
The fetters of the form realm manifest.
There are fetters that do not fall into the form realm, nor are they in the form realm.
That is to say:
Being bound by the entanglements, one falls from the desire realm.
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire realm and the existence of birth.
Falling from the desire realm and being born in the formless realm.
Falling from the formless realm and being born in the formless realm.
Falling from the formless realm and being born in the desire realm.
And abiding in the desire realm.
The fetters of the desire realm and formless realm manifest.
Abiding in the formless realm, the fetters of the formless realm manifest.
Are the fetters that fall into the formless realm, are those fetters in the formless realm?
Answer:
The fetters that are in the formless realm, those fetters fall into the formless realm.
There are fetters that fall into the formless realm, but those fetters are not in the formless realm.
That is to say:
Abiding in the desire and form realms, the fetters of the formless realm manifest.
Are the fetters that do not fall into the desire realm, are those fetters not in the desire realm?
Answer:
One should make four alternatives.
The opposite should be known.
Are all the bonds not falling into the form realm, those bonds not in the form realm?
Answer:
One should make four alternatives.
The opposite should be known.
Are all the bonds not falling into the formless realm, those bonds not in the formless realm?
Answer:
It is like this.
There are bonds not in the formless realm, those bonds not not falling into the formless realm.
Namely:
Abiding in the desire and form realms.
The formless realm bonds manifest.
The fully seeing World-Honored One's disciples.
All forms that are not yet eliminated, are those forms bound?
Answer:
It is like this.
If forms are bound, are those forms not yet eliminated?
Answer:
It is like this.
All feelings, perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness that are not yet eliminated, are those feelings, perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness bound?
Answer:
It is like this.
There are those who are bound by feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness, but whose feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness have not yet been severed.
This refers to:
those who are reborn in the same family seven times at most,ğŸ”½those who return once,
those who are destined to the intermediate state,
who have already severed and completely known the middling and superior fetters to be severed through cultivation in the desire realm.
The inferior fetters are still binding their associated feelings, perceptions, volitions, and consciousness.
For the fully awakened disciples of the World-Honored One, if form has already been severed, is that form also untied?
Answer:
It is so.
If form is untied, has that form already been severed?
Answer:
It is so.ğŸ”½As for feelings, perceptions, volitions, and consciousness that have already been severed,
are those feelings, perceptions, volitions, and consciousness also untied?
Answer:
Those feelings, perceptions, volitions, and consciousness that are untiedğŸ”½have already been severed.
There are those whose feelings, perceptions, volitions, and consciousness have already been severed, but are not untied.
This refers to:
those who are reborn in the same family seven times at most,
those who return once,
Or one interval.
In the desire realm, the upper and middle grades of fetters to be eliminated by cultivation have already been eliminated and thoroughly known.
The corresponding feelings, perceptions, volitional formations, and consciousness of the lower grades of fetters are bound.
There are five types of pudgala, namely:
One who follows faith, one who follows the Dharma, one with faith and understanding, one who has attained by insight, and one who has attained by body.
As for these five types of pudgala, regarding the three fetters... up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions, how many do they possess?
How many do they not possess?
The answer is:
One who follows faith:
Regarding the three fetters:
When the knowledge of the class of suffering has not yet arisen:
All are possessed.
When the knowledge of the class of suffering has already arisen:
Two are possessed, one is not possessed.
Regarding the three unwholesome roots:
Not yet free from the defilements of desire:
All are possessed.
Already free from the defilements of desire:
All are not possessed.
Regarding the three taints:
Not yet free from the defilements of desire:
All are possessed.
Already free from the defilements of desire:
two are perfected, and one is not perfected.
Regarding the four floods, yokes, and clingings:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
all are perfected.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
three are perfected, and one is not perfected.
Regarding the four bodily ties:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
all are perfected.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
two are perfected, and two are not perfected.
Regarding the five hindrances:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
when the knowledge of the dharmas of the path has not yet arisen, all are perfected;
when the knowledge of the dharmas of the path has already arisen, four are perfected, and one is not perfected.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
all are not perfected.
Regarding the five bonds:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
all are perfected.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
two are perfected, and three are not perfected.
Regarding the five lower fetters:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
when the knowledge of the aspects of the truth of suffering has not yet arisen, all are perfected.
When the cognition of the class of suffering has already arisen, four are accomplished and one is not yet accomplished.
Having already become free from the attachment of the desire realm:ğŸ”½When the cognition of the class of suffering has not yet arisen, three are accomplished and two are not yet accomplished.
When the cognition of the class of suffering has already arisen, two are accomplished and three are not yet accomplished.
Regarding the five higher fetters:
Not yet free from attachment to the form realm:
All are accomplished.
Having already become free from attachment to the form realm:
Four are accomplished and one is not yet accomplished.
Regarding the five views:
When the cognition of the class of suffering has not yet arisen, all are accomplished.
When the cognition of the class of suffering has already arisen, three are accomplished and two are not yet accomplished.
Regarding the six bases of contact:
Not yet free from attachment to the desire realm:
All are accomplished.
Having already become free from attachment to the desire realm, but not yet free from attachment to the Brahma realm:
Four are accomplished and two are not yet accomplished.
Having already become free from attachment to the Brahma realm:
One is accomplished and five are not yet accomplished.
Regarding the seven latent afflictions:
Not yet free from attachment to the desire realm:
All are accomplished.
Those who have already become free from the defilements of the desire realm:
Five are accomplished, and two are not accomplished.
Regarding the nine fetters:
Those who have not yet become free from the defilements of the desire realm:
All are accomplished.
Those who have already become free from the defilements of the desire realm:
Six are accomplished, and three are not accomplished.
Regarding the ninety-eight latent afflictions:
Those who have not yet become free from the defilements of the desire realm:
When the cognition of the truth of suffering has not yet arisen:
All are accomplished.
When the cognition of the truth of suffering has arisen, but the cognition of the similarity of suffering has not yet arisen:
Those to be eliminated by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm are all not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the cognition of the truth of accumulation has arisen, but the cognition of the similarity of accumulation has not yet arisen:
Those to be eliminated by seeing the truth of suffering in the three realms are all not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the cognition of the truth of accumulation has arisen, but the cognition of the similarity of accumulation has not yet arisen:
Those to be eliminated by seeing the truth of suffering in the three realms and those to be eliminated by seeing the truth of accumulation in the desire realm are all not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the cognition of the similarity of accumulation has arisen, but the cognition of the truth of cessation has not yet arisen:
Those eliminated by seeing suffering and its cause in the three realms are all not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the cessation of the dharma realm has already arisen, but the knowledge of the cessation of the species has not yet arisen:
Those eliminated by seeing suffering and its cause in the three realms, and those eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm, are all not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the cessation of the species has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path of the dharma realm has not yet arisen:
Those eliminated by seeing suffering, its cause, and cessation in the three realms are all not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the path of the dharma realm has already arisen:
Those eliminated by seeing suffering, its cause, and cessation in the three realms, and those eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm, are all not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
Having already been free from the defilements of desire, but not yet free from the defilements of form:
When the knowledge of the species of suffering has not yet arisen:
All in the desire realm are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the species of suffering has already arisen, but the knowledge of the species of accumulation has not yet arisen:
All in the desire realm, and those eliminated by seeing suffering in the form and formless realms, are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the class of origination has already arisen but the knowledge of the class of cessation has not yet arisen:
All in the desire realm, and those eliminated by seeing suffering and origination in the form and formless realms, are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the class of cessation has already arisen:
All in the desire realm, and those eliminated by seeing suffering, origination, and cessation in the form and formless realms, are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
Having already been free from attachment to form:
When the knowledge of the class of suffering has not yet arisen:
All in the desire and form realms are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the class of suffering has already arisen but the knowledge of the class of origination has not yet arisen:
All in the desire and form realms, and those eliminated by seeing suffering in the formless realm, are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the class of origination has already arisen but the knowledge of the class of cessation has not yet arisen:
All [afflictions] in the desire and form realms.
And those eliminated by seeing suffering and accumulation in the formless realm are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
When the knowledge of the extinction class has already arisen:
All [afflictions] in the desire and form realms, and those eliminated by seeing suffering, accumulation, and extinction in the formless realm are not accomplished.
The rest are all accomplished.
As with the faith-follower,
the Dharma-follower is also like this.
The faith-liberated one:
In the three bonds,
all are not accomplished.
In the three unwholesome roots,
those not yet free from desire-attachment
all accomplish.
Those already free from desire-attachment
all do not accomplish.
In the three contaminants,
those not yet free from desire-attachment
all accomplish.
Those already free from desire-attachment
accomplish two and do not accomplish one.
In the four floods and yokes, those not yet free from desire-attachment
accomplish three and do not accomplish one.
Those already free from desire-attachment
accomplish two and do not accomplish two.
Regarding the four kinds of grasping,
those who have not yet abandoned desire:
two are accomplished, two are not accomplished.
Those who have already abandoned desire:
one is accomplished, three are not accomplished.
Regarding the four kinds of bodily bondage,
those who have not yet abandoned desire:
two are accomplished, two are not accomplished.
Those who have already abandoned desire:
all are not accomplished.
Regarding the five hindrances,
those who have not yet abandoned desire:
four are accomplished, one is not accomplished.
Those who have already abandoned desire:
all are not accomplished.
Regarding the five bonds,
those who have not yet abandoned desire:
all are accomplished.
Those who have already abandoned desire:
two are accomplished, three are not accomplished.
Regarding the five lower bonds,
those who have not yet abandoned desire:
two are accomplished, three are not accomplished.
Those who have already abandoned desire:
all are not accomplished.
Regarding the five upper bonds,
those who have not yet abandoned form:
all are accomplished.
Those who have already abandoned form:
four are accomplished, and one is not accomplished.
This is in the case of the five views.
All are not accomplished.
In the case of the six bases of craving,
those who are not yet free from attachment to desire realm objects,
all are accomplished.
Those who are already free from attachment to desire realm objects but not yet free from attachment to the Brahma realm,
four are accomplished, and two are not accomplished.
Those who are already free from attachment to the Brahma realm,
one is accomplished, and five are not accomplished.
In the case of the seven latent afflictions,
those who are not yet free from attachment to desire realm objects,
five are accomplished, and two are not accomplished.
Those who are already free from attachment to desire realm objects,
three are accomplished, and four are not accomplished.
In the case of the nine fetters,
those who are not yet free from attachment to desire realm objects,
six are accomplished, and three are not accomplished.
Those who are already free from attachment to desire realm objects,
three are accomplished, and six are not accomplished.
In the case of the ninety-eight latent afflictions,
those who are not yet free from attachment to desire realm objects,
ten are accomplished, and eighty-eight are not accomplished.
Those who are already free from attachment to desire realm objects but not yet free from attachment to form realm objects,
Six are accomplished, and ninety-two are not accomplished.
Having already become free from attachment to the form realm:
Three are accomplished, and ninety-five are not accomplished.
As with one of superior resolve through faith;
One of superior resolve through insight is also like this.
One who has attained bodily witness:
With regard to the three bonds and three unwholesome roots:
All are not accomplished.
With regard to the three contaminants:
Two are accomplished, and one is not accomplished.
With regard to the four floods and four yokes:
Two are accomplished, and two are not accomplished.
With regard to the four graspings:
One is accomplished, and three are not accomplished.
With regard to the four bodily ties and five hindrances:
All are not accomplished.
With regard to the five lower bonds:
Two are accomplished, and three are not accomplished.
With regard to the five upper bonds:
Four are accomplished, and one is not accomplished.
With regard to the five views:
All are not accomplished.
With regard to the six bases of contact:
One is accomplished, and five are not accomplished.
Among the seven latent afflictions,
three are accomplished, and four are not accomplished.
Among the nine fetters,
three are accomplished, and six are not accomplished.
Among the ninety-eight latent afflictions,
three are accomplished, and ninety-five are not accomplished.
How many conditions does the view of self and existence serve as for the view of self and existence?

How many conditions does the view of self and existence serve as for the grasping of precepts and rituals... up to the latent afflictions of ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm?

... up to how many conditions do the latent afflictions of ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm serve as for the latent afflictions of ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm?

How many conditions do the latent afflictions of ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm serve as for the view of self and existence... up to the latent afflictions of pride to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm?
The answer is:
The view of self and existence serves as either four, three, two, or one condition for the view of self and existence.
What are the four?

For example, when the view of the real existence of the body arises immediately after the view of the real existence of the body, if one contemplates the previously arisen [view of the real existence of the body] and the subsequently arisen [view of the real existence of the body], they become four conditions.
How are they three?

For example, when the view of the real existence of the body arises immediately after the view of the real existence of the body, if one does not contemplate the previously arisen [view of the real existence of the body] and the subsequently arisen [view of the real existence of the body], they become three conditions.
Excluding the object condition.

Or when a mind other than the view of the real existence of the body arises immediately after the view of the real existence of the body, and subsequently the view of the real existence of the body arises, if one contemplates the previously arisen [view of the real existence of the body] and the subsequently arisen [view of the real existence of the body], they become three conditions.
Excluding the immediately preceding condition.
How are they two?

When a mind other than the view of the real existence of the body arises immediately after the view of the real existence of the body, and subsequently the view of the real existence of the body arises, if one does not contemplate the previously arisen [view of the real existence of the body] and the subsequently arisen [view of the real existence of the body], they become two conditions.
Namely:
Cause and dominant influence.
How is it one?
The subsequently arisen view of the real existence of the body and the previously arisen view of the real existence of the body:
If it becomes the object, it becomes the object and dominant influence.
If it does not become the object, it is one dominant influence.
Future satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i and past and present satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i:
If it is taken as an object, it is the object and the dominant [condition];
If it is not taken as an object, it is one dominant [condition].
Future and present satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i and past satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i:
If it is taken as an object, it is the object and the dominant [condition];
If it is not taken as an object, it is one dominant [condition].
The satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the desire realm and the satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the form and formless realms:
They are one dominant [condition].
The satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the form and formless realms and the satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the desire realm:
If it is the immediately preceding [condition], it is the immediately preceding [condition] and the dominant [condition];
If it is not the immediately preceding [condition], it is one dominant [condition].
The satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the form realm and the satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the formless realm:
They are one dominant [condition].
The satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the formless realm and the satkÄya-drá¹›á¹£á¹­i of the form realm:
If it is the immediately preceding [condition], it is the immediately preceding [condition] and the dominant [condition];
It is not a similar and immediately antecedent condition, but it is one dominant condition.
Just as with the view of self and the view of self, you should understand:
The view of self and the other non-pervasive [views], the other non-pervasive [views] and all non-pervasive [views], all pervasive [views] and all non-pervasive [views], are also like this.
The view of self and the grasping of precepts and rituals, are:
Either four, three, two, or one condition.
What are the four?
If the grasping of precepts and rituals arises immediately after the view of self, and one contemplates the former arising and the latter arising, they are four conditions.
What are the three?
If the grasping of precepts and rituals arises immediately after the view of self, but one does not contemplate the former arising and the latter arising, they are three conditions.
Excluding the object condition.
Or if the grasping of precepts and rituals arises immediately after a mind other than the view of self, and one contemplates the former arising and the latter arising, they are three conditions.
Excluding the similar and immediately antecedent condition.
What are the two?

For example, when a mind other than the view of self exists, and later the grasping of precepts and vows arises, not contemplating the previously arisen and the later arisen, they become two conditions.
Namely:
Cause and dominant condition.
How is it one?
The later arisen view of self and the previously arisen grasping of precepts and vows:
If it is taken as an object, it is the object and dominant condition;
If it is not taken as an object, it is one dominant condition.
The future view of self and the past and present grasping of precepts and vows:
If it is taken as an object, it is the object and dominant condition;
If it is not taken as an object, it is one dominant condition.
The future and present view of self and the past grasping of precepts and vows:
If it is taken as an object, it is the object and dominant condition;
If it is not taken as an object, it is one dominant condition.
The view of self in the desire realm and the grasping of precepts and vows in the form and formless realms:
It is one dominant condition.
The view of self in the form and formless realms and the grasping of precepts and vows in the desire realm:

If it acts as an object but not as an equal and immediate antecedent, it is an object and an enabling cause.ğŸ”½If it acts as an equal and immediate antecedent but not as an object, it is an equal and immediate antecedent, an object, and an enabling cause.
If it acts as an equal and immediate antecedent and as an object, it is an equal and immediate antecedent, an object, and an enabling cause.
If it does not act as an equal and immediate antecedent and as an object, it is an enabling cause.
The view of existence in the form realm and the grasping of precepts and practices in the formless realm:
are one enabling cause.

The view of existence in the formless realm and the grasping of precepts and practices in the form realm:ğŸ”½If it acts as an object but not as an equal and immediate antecedent, it is an object and an enabling cause.
If it acts as an equal and immediate antecedent but not as an object, it is an equal and immediate antecedent and an enabling cause.
If it acts as an equal and immediate antecedent and as an object, it is an equal and immediate antecedent, an object, and an enabling cause.
If it does not act as an equal and immediate antecedent and as an object, it is an enabling cause.
Just as with the view of existence and the grasping of precepts and practices, one should understand:

The view of existence and the rest of the universal permeating mental factors, the universal permeating mental factors and the rest of the universal permeating mental factors, and the rest of the non-universal permeating mental factors and the universal permeating mental factors, are also like this.
One line, six times, small, large, seven, inclusion, existenceğŸ”½Dependent, bound, path, complete knowledge
This chapter, I wish to fully explain
There are nine fetters, namely:
The fetter of craving.
... up to the fetter of stinginess.
If there is the fetter of craving binding to this thing, is there also the fetter of anger binding?
Answer:
If there is the fetter of anger binding to this thing, there must be the fetter of craving binding.
There may be the fetter of craving binding, but not the fetter of anger binding.
This refers to:
The fetter of craving that has not yet been eliminated with regard to the dharmas of the form and formless realms.
If there is the fetter of craving binding to this thing, is there also the fetter of pride binding?
Answer:
It is like this.
If there is the fetter of pride binding, is there also the fetter of craving binding?
Answer:
It is like this.
If there is the fetter of craving regarding this thing, is there also the fetter of ignorance?
Answer:
If there is the fetter of craving regarding this thing, there must be the fetter of ignorance.
There may be the fetter of ignorance but not the fetter of craving.
This means:

When the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen, regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, there is the fetter of ignorance to be eliminated by seeing accumulation that has not yet been eliminated.
If there is the fetter of craving regarding this thing, is there also the fetter of views?
Answer:
Four sentences should be made.
There may be the fetter of craving but not the fetter of views.
This means:
When the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,

regarding dharmas not associated with the fetter of views to be eliminated by seeing cessation and the path, and regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, there is the fetter of craving that has not yet been eliminated.
When the knowledge of cessation has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,

regarding dharmas not associated with the fetter of views to be eliminated by seeing the path, and regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, there is the fetter of craving that has not yet been eliminated.
The fully seeing disciples of the World-Honored One:
Regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, there is attachment that has not yet been eliminated.
There may be the bond of view but not the bond of attachment.
This is:
When the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, there is the bond of view to be eliminated by seeing accumulation that has not yet been eliminated.
There may be the bond of both.
This is:
Those who are fully bound:
Regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing and cultivation, there are bonds of both.
When the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing accumulation, cessation, path, and cultivation, there are bonds of both.
When the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas associated with the bond of view to be eliminated by seeing cessation and path, there are bonds of both.
When the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas associated with the bond of view to be eliminated by seeing the path, there are bonds of both.
There may be no bonds of both.
This is:
When the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen, but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering and accumulation, there are no two bonds.
When the knowledge of cessation has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, accumulation, and cessation, there are no two bonds.
The fully seeing BhagavÄn's disciples:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, there are no two bonds.
Having already been free from the defilements of desire:
With regard to dharmas of the desire realm, there are no two bonds.
Having already been free from the defilements of form:
With regard to dharmas of the desire and form realms, there are no two bonds.
Having already been free from the defilements of the formless:
With regard to dharmas of the three realms, there are no two bonds.
As with the bonds of views;
With regard to the bonds of doubt, it is the same.
If there is bondage of the fetter of craving with regard to this thing, is there also bondage of the fetter of grasping?
Answer:
Four sentences should be made.
There may be bondage of the fetter of craving, but no bondage of the fetter of grasping.
This is:
When the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen, but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen:
Regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, the fetter of craving has not yet been eliminated.
When the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, the fetter of craving has not yet been eliminated.
The fully seeing BhagavÄn's disciples,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, the fetter of craving has not yet been eliminated.
There may be one who is bound by the fetter of grasping but not by the fetter of craving.
This refers to:
When the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the truth of suffering, the fetter of grasping to be eliminated by seeing the truth of accumulation has not yet been eliminated.
There may be one who is bound by both.
This refers to:
One who is fully bound,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing and cultivation, is bound by two fetters.
When the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the truths of accumulation, cessation, and path, and by cultivation, one is bound by two fetters.
When the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the truths of cessation and path, one is bound by two fetters.
When the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
In the dharmas to be eliminated by the path of seeing, there are two kinds of bonds.
Or there may be no two bonds at all.
This is because:
When the knowledge of the origin [of suffering] has already arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,
in the dharmas eliminated by seeing suffering and the origin [of suffering], there are no two bonds.
When the knowledge of cessation has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
in the dharmas eliminated by seeing suffering, the origin [of suffering], and cessation [of suffering], there are no two bonds.
The fully seeing BhagavÄn's disciples,
in the dharmas eliminated by seeing, have no two bonds.
Having already been free from the defilements of desire,
in the dharmas of the desire realm, there are no two bonds.
Having already been free from the defilements of form,
in the dharmas of the desire and form realms, there are no two bonds.
Having already been free from the defilements of the formless,
in the dharmas of the three realms, there are no two bonds.
If there is the bond of craving in a certain thing, is there also the bond of jealousy?
Answer:ğŸ”½If there is the bond of jealousy in a certain thing, there must be the bond of craving.ğŸ”½There may be the bond of craving but not the bond of jealousy.
Here is the corrected and aligned text:
It means:
In the desire realm, the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, and in the form and formless realms, the bonds of craving that have not yet been eliminated.
As with the bonds of jealousy;
The bonds of stinginess are also the same.
As the bonds of craving are applied to the latter, forming a single line;
The bonds of pride are applied to the latter, forming a single line, and it is the same.
If there is bondage of the bond of anger towards a certain thing, is there also bondage of the bond of pride?
Answer:
If there is bondage of the bond of anger towards a certain thing, there must be bondage of the bond of pride.
There may be bondage of the bond of pride, but not bondage of the bond of anger.
It means:
In the form and formless realms, the bonds of pride that have not yet been eliminated.
If there is bondage of the bond of anger towards a certain thing, is there also bondage of the bond of ignorance?
Answer:
If there is bondage of the bond of anger towards a certain thing, there must be bondage of the bond of ignorance.
There may be bondage of the bond of ignorance, but not bondage of the bond of anger.ğŸ”½It means:
Those who have not yet eliminated desire realm attachment, for whom the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen:
In the desire realm, regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, there is the ignorance bond that has not yet been eliminated, which is to be eliminated by seeing the origin.
In the form and formless realms, there is the ignorance bond that has not yet been eliminated.
If there is the resentment bond binding to this thing, is there also the view bond binding?
Answer:
One should make four sentences.
There may be the resentment bond binding, but not the view bond binding.
This refers to:
One who has not yet eliminated desire realm attachment, for whom the cognition of accumulation has arisen but the cognition of cessation has not yet arisen,

regarding dharmas dissociated from the view bond to be eliminated by seeing cessation and the path in the desire realm, and regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the resentment bond has not yet been eliminated.
For whom the cognition of cessation has arisen but the cognition of the path has not yet arisen,

regarding dharmas dissociated from the view bond to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm, and regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the resentment bond has not yet been eliminated.
Fully seeing disciples of the World-Honored One who have not yet eliminated desire realm attachment,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the resentment bond has not yet been eliminated.
There may be one who is bound by the fetter of views but not by the fetter of anger.
Namely, one who has not yet abandoned desire realm attachment, for whom the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm, the fetter of views that is to be eliminated by seeing accumulation has not yet been eliminated.
With regard to dharmas in the form and formless realms, the fetter of views has not yet been eliminated.
There may be one who is bound by both.
Namely,
one who is completely bound:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing and cultivation in the desire realm, one is bound by two fetters.
For one who has not yet abandoned desire realm attachment, for whom the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing accumulation, cessation, and the path, and by cultivation in the desire realm, one is bound by two fetters.
For one for whom the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas associated with the fetter of views to be eliminated by seeing cessation and the path in the desire realm, one is bound by two fetters.
For one for whom the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas associated with the fetter of views to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm, one is bound by two fetters.
There may be cases where both are unattached.
This is the case of:
The knowledge of the origin [of suffering] has already arisen, but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen.
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by [the path of] insight into suffering and its origin,

and with regard to dharmas not associated with the view of the aggregates as real personality in the realms of form and formlessness to be eliminated by [the path of] insight into cessation and the path, as well as with regard to dharmas to be eliminated by [the path of] cultivation in the realms of form and formlessness, there is no bondage of the two fetters.
The knowledge of cessation has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen.
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by [the path of] insight into suffering, its origin, and cessation,

and with regard to dharmas not associated with the view of the aggregates as real personality in the realms of form and formlessness to be eliminated by [the path of] insight into the path, as well as with regard to dharmas to be eliminated by [the path of] cultivation in the realms of form and formlessness, there is no bondage of the two fetters.
The World-Honored One's disciples who have fully seen [the four noble truths]:
Those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the desire realm,

with regard to dharmas to be eliminated by [the path of] insight and dharmas to be eliminated by [the path of] cultivation in the realms of form and formlessness, there is no bondage of the two fetters.
Those who have already eliminated the defilements of the desire realm,
with regard to dharmas in the desire realm, there is no bondage of the two fetters.
Those who have already eliminated the defilements of the form realm,
In the desire and form realms, there are no two fetters that bind.
Having already separated from the defilements of the formless realm:
In the dharmas of the three realms, there are no two fetters that bind.
As with the view fetters,
the doubt fetters are also the same.
If there is bondage by the enmity fetter in this matter, is there also bondage by the grasping fetter?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There may be bondage by the enmity fetter, but no bondage by the grasping fetter.
This refers to:
Those who have not yet separated from desire-realm defilements:
The cognition of accumulation has already arisen, but the cognition of cessation has not yet arisen.
In the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the enmity fetter has not yet been eliminated.
The cognition of cessation has already arisen, but the cognition of the path has not yet arisen.
In the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the enmity fetter has not yet been eliminated.
The fully seeing disciples of the World-Honored One who have not yet separated from desire-realm defilements:
In the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the enmity fetter has not yet been eliminated.
There may be bondage by the grasping fetter, but no bondage by the enmity fetter.
This refers to:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm, for whom the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm, the fetter of grasping that is to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation has not yet been eliminated.
With regard to dharmas in the form and formless realms, the fetter of grasping has not yet been eliminated.
There may be two that are bound together.
That is to say:
Those who are fully bound:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing and cultivation in the desire realm, there are two fetters that bind.
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
For whom the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation, cessation, path, and cultivation in the desire realm, there are two fetters that bind.
For whom the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing cessation and the path in the desire realm, there are two fetters that bind.
For whom the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm, there are two fetters that bind.
There may be two that are not bound together.
That is to say:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm:
When the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering and accumulation, and with regard to dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there are no two bonds.
When the knowledge of cessation has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen:

With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, accumulation, and cessation, and with regard to dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there are no two bonds.
The fully seeing BhagavÄn's disciples:
Not yet free from the defilements of desire:
With regard to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, and with regard to dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there are no two bonds.
Already free from the defilements of desire:
With regard to dharmas in the desire realm, there are no two bonds.
Already free from the defilements of form:
With regard to dharmas in the desire and form realms, there are no two bonds.
Already free from the defilements of the formless:
With regard to dharmas in the three realms, there are no two bonds.
If there is bondage of resentment towards this matter, is there also bondage of jealousy?
Answer:ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
If there is the fetter of envy regarding this thing, there must be the fetter of anger.
There may be the fetter of anger but not the fetter of envy.
This is the case:
Regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing in the desire realm, the fetter of anger has not yet been eliminated.
As with the fetter of envy;
The same applies to the fetter of stinginess.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
